page.title: 10FARMING-MIXED HUSBANDRY.
page.content: Much of our land is farmland under cultivation.One large area is cultivated on a pick your own basis & grows strawberries,raspberries, blackcurrants & gooseberries.Other farms have sheep & cattle.As there is a river,which floods,running through the lower part of this area it provides rich pasture land.The land is enclosed by hedges which contain many trees including damson trees. Cultivated land is used for silage, hay,wheat & barley.Usually there are hop fields which supply the firm of Guiness.There are a few orchards but at one time there were far more but these have made way for pasture and housing.There is rough grazing for the sheep.Most farms do not have many manual workers except on a seasonal basis but even so farms are fairly well mechanised.
